title: new regulations enforce coronavirus restrictions agreed stormont
story: Under the powers, fines of up to pound, can be handed out to those failing to follow laws aimed at preventing the spread of Covid-.The regulations, which are in force from pm on Saturday,flow from the emergency laws passed at Westminster earlier in the week.They ban gatherings of more than two people.They also include a list of which type of business premises should close during the current clampdown on public le, and which can continue operating as an essential service.Those workplaces that remain open must comply with strict rules on social distancing.The Executive has agreed new powers to combat the spread of Coronavirus and save lives.The powers will come into force at pm tonight. #Read the full statement ##https:t.co CgEKBJcmdash NI ExecutiveMarch , The executive said manufacturing and most of the service sector would not be affected by the closure orders.The Health ProtectionRegulations result from the emergency legislation passed at Westminster.They give the authorities the power to close certain premises and prohibit anyone from leaving home without a reasonable excuse.The executive faced some criticism for theof time it has taken to translate the Westminster laws into legally enforceable powers in Northern Ireland.The deaths of two further people with coronavirus in Northern Ireland were reported on Saturday, taking the regionrsquos death toll to .There were  new positive cases of Covid- reported on Saturday, bringing the total number of confirmed cases in Northern Ireland to , according to the Public Health Agency. vw,vw,px, px"Arlene Foster said the regulations were extraordinary powers for extraordinary times Commenting on the introduction of the powers, First Minister Arlene Foster said: ldquoThese are extraordinary powers for any Government to have to introduce, but we are living in extraordinary times.ldquoWe are asking the people of Northern Ireland to make fundamental changes to how they live their lives. But we are doing this to keep you safe, to flatten the curve of the Covid- infection so that the health service has the capacity to deal with those who need their help the most.ldquoWe know the enormity of what we are asking of the public, but it is proportionate to the threat we all face from this deadly virus. No-one is immune.New Executive powers agreed to protect citizens ##bullPower to close premisesbullProhibit anyone leaving home without a reasonable excusebullGatherings of more than  people bannedbullFines up to pound, for non-compliancePowers will come into effect from pm tonight #COVIDmdash Michelle OrsquoNeillMarch , Deputy First Minister Michelle OrsquoNeill said: ldquoProtecting the public, supporting the health service and saving lives are the priorities for the executive during this crisis.ldquoEach one of us has a personal responsibility to do everything we can to fight back against Covid- for the good of everyone across society. Thatrsquos why we are asking everyone to comply with the new measures being introduced today.ldquoAs an executive, we donrsquot want to get to the stage where people are being fined for being out when they should be at home. Butanyone ndash even after everything they have heard or seen over the last few weeks ndash still believes that this does not apply to them, then we will use every power we have to ensure people stay at home so that we save as many lives as we possibly can.Health Minister Robin Swann said: ldquoThe coronavirus pandemic is affecting every one of us, and every aspect of public le. We think particularly of those who have lost loved ones to this virus.ldquoThese emergency regulations are an essential component of the strategy to tackle the pandemic and will ensure a consistent approach across the four regions of the UK.ldquoThe extreme disruption to normal le would have been unthinkable just a few short weeks ago. It is a price we all have to pay, to protect each other and the health service. Everyone has to take personal responsibility for their actions and to stick rigidly to these restrictions for as long as they are needed. It is a matter of le and death.SDLP leader Colum Eastwood criticised how Mrs Foster and Ms OrsquoNeill announced the regulations, without a press conference.The regulations were announced by way of a press release and accompanying tweet from the Executive Office. vw,vw,px, px"SDLP Colum Eastwood criticised how the regulations were announced The Foyle MP said ldquohuge decisions need to be managed in a better way than ldquotweets on a Saturday night.ldquoThe people of Northern Ireland deserve more than a tweet announcing a lockdown and enforcement powers, he said.ldquoThese are huge measures and people deserve leadership.ldquoOur communities have been leading the way, staying home and doing all they can to protect their loved ones. Itrsquos time everyone stepped up.ldquoMake no mistake, in the next few weeks, people will die. We all have a responsibility to limit the spread to protect as many people as possible.ldquoThis is no time for political games ndash nor for hiding ndash the First Minister and deputy First Minister canrsquot just hold press conferences Monday to Friday during office hours ndash coronavirus doesnrsquot wait, it doesnrsquot take weekends off nor do the thousands of doctors and nurses fighting on the frontline.ldquoItrsquos time to get real. Letrsquos all show leadership ndash and letrsquos stay at home and save lives.
